reviews.review: So damn good

Gran juego excelente historia, una curva de dificultad decente, los controles esta bien dentro  de su época de salida, los plasmidos de este juego son excelente, si lo comparamos con los otros 2 bioshock este este es el mas lineal, pero no quita que sea disfrutable de jugar 10/10, para mi uno de los primeros  juego que vi cuando youtube empezó a crecer como plataforma,  un juego que deberías tener como una de las primeras adquisiciones que tengas en steam si vas empezando en este mundillo del gaming.

This game is REALLY good, but for different reasons than the first game being really good. If you're wanting a horror experience, you may not be satisfied with this game. But a narrative and gameplay experience? Pretty damn good. The atmosphere is one very alien to the first game, but I think that adds to its charm. It shows a very different kind of dystopia.

Jest typowym supportem, ale przyznaję, że miodnie się strzelało choć końcówka była meh. Tak czy inaczej... Polecam

игра проходится на одном дыхании. по началу тебе кажется что игра не очень прям и сверх крутая, но под конец ты афигеваешь от того, что происходит в этой игре. сюжет под конец заставляет сходить с ума. по статистике в среднем игра проходится за 12 часов и 8 при быстром прохождении. я прошёл почти за 8 и всё равно остался очень доволен. по скольку я купил коллекцию всех биошоков, то 100% нужно будет пройти первые 2, но даже бес прохождения первых двух, я понял весь сюжет и остался крайне доволен

I think the story made sense to me if there are plot holes feel free to comment them i played bioshock and bioshock infinite for the first time this year. Definitely preferred infinite. Infinite has the best character work, and biggest ideas.

Probably the best in the series in my opinion. It's similar to Bioshock 1 in gameplay, but has a lot more mobility and options when it comes to fighting enemies and the way you deal with them. It has a really good story though a little bit confusing towards the end. Not sure how I felt about the ending as a whole to be honest. But there are some cool secrets to look out for throughout the game so exploration can really pay off. Also the environment and effects look very pleasing so don't rush through the game. 

Overall I'd say Bioshock Infinite is well worth the money and I can almost guarantee you'll have a fun time with it.

Да, учитывая что играл я на стареньком компьютере и не смог вдоволь насладиться графикой, насладился я по полной. Сюжет затянул своими загадками и вопросами, а эта малышка заставляла переживать меня каждый раз когда она попадала в передряги. Конец убил конечно... Думаю теперь пройти другие части и теперь ищу свою Элизабет

I've been meaning to play this game for years and I'm finally glad that I did. If I were to rank the Bioshock trilogy I would rank Infinite as the second best game in the franchise. I'm glad that after Bioshock 2 they took us to a new location in Columbia and away from Rapture. The new setting felt fresh even though a lot of the mechanics felt the same just dressed up differently (vigors instead of plasmids for example) and the skyline movement and combat also added a new feature to the game that was fun to learn and get good at. The story is great in my opinion and gets deep with all the multiversal tear stuff, however, it could never beat the end-reveal of the original Bioshock. Definitely worth a play through.

Jogo com uma história impecável. Honestamente é a melhor história dos games que já vi, a gameplay não é nada absurda ou inovadora, visto que é um jogo de 2013, mas ela é extremamente divertida, te dá total liberdade de ser criativo com suas combinações de Vigores com suas armas. 

A arte e a ambientação de Columbia seguem sendo perfeitas ao extremo, 10/10 e as mais lindas de todos os jogos já feitos. 

Os personagens (tanto o Booker quanto a Elizabeth) são extremamente desenvolvidos, sendo a Elizabeth minha personagem feminina favorita dos jogos e sendo extremamente carismática e tendo uma evolução absurda, começando o jogo como uma personagem e terminando como outra completamente diferente, mais madura, mais fria.

A história, como citado acima, é muito boa, podendo ser vista em vários Voxofones ou no Cinetoscópios, tendo um final absurdo de explodidor de cabeça e como envolve realidades paralelas, não esperem algo muito simples e redondinho. Você bate cabeça em algumas partes rs.

É o meu terceiro jogo favorito, tendo jogado até mesmo as DLC's, que é um enorme epílogo do jogo base, então logicamente não poderia deixar de recomendar pra qualquer pessoa que curte jogos
Its an amazing game with perfect balance of vigor and gun play, offers an amazing story and I highly recommend that you play it

Sehr schöne Atmosphäre sei es durch Charaktere, Texte, Umgebungen oder Aktionen.
Die Welten und verschiedenen Gebiete fühlen und sehen wundervoll aus und erkunden wird belohnt, sei es durch Upgrades, Geld oder Errungenschaften :D und ich liebe Errungenschaften.

Gibt ne Menge zusehen und das Geld ( hatte es für knapp 10 Euro gekauft) mehr als wert.
Und obwohl das Spiel schon 9 Jahre alt ist, hat es seinen Grafischen Charme nicht verloren.
Vor allem weil ich noch den Season Pass und 3 DLC dazu bekommen hab.

Ehrenspiel
This game transcends entertainment and becomes a work of art. It was amazing in 2013 and it's amazing now.

A beautiful game! Love the combat, vigors (plasmids) and characters! Beautiful city and music, traversing the city is enjoyable, the story is gripping, and you don't have to play Bioshock 1 and 2 to enjoy (though it's recommended!). A game that I wanted to replay as soon as I finished my first playthrough.

The game is utterly bugged. I haven't even killed the Songbird and I have already had to repeat entire missions because Elizabeth gets stuck or the elevators won't work or an interactable object becomes uninteractable and I can't continue.

Elizabeth becomes useless when trying to interact with anything when a single soldier is loaded and alive in the same level. In some cases I had to search an entire level for a single enemy because if I don't kill it Elizabeth won't unlock a door.

I have played Bioshock 1 and 2 previously and enjoyed them but this one is awfully implemented.

Wonderful game, I loved it. Familiar Bioshock tone/themes in a beautiful new setting with strong characters, I had a blast in Columbia (10/10 would take down airships with a giant bird again). It was great fun using the different Vigors and tears, along with the usual vibe of scavenging for supplies while exploring the city. Great soundtrack - the random anachronistic versions of songs like 'Girls Just Wanna Have Fun' were a great touch. My family sang 'Will The Circle Be Unbroken' at my grandfather's funeral last year, so hearing it through the game had me a bit emotional.

Burial at Sea was a good final chapter tying the games together (so great to get back to Rapture). I liked the shorter story-driven length and different challenges (greater need for rationing ammo/health, and playing as Elizabeth requires more stealth). It felt like a good conclusion to a truly brilliant series. Sad my first experience of Bioshock Infinite is over but I'll definitely play it again.
